current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish the United States Advisory Council on Human
		  Trafficking to review Federal Government policy on human
		  trafficking.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
United States Advisory
			 Council on Human Trafficking

), which shall
			 provide advice and recommendations to the

nongovernmental
			 experts or professionals in the human trafficking field.

be
			 comprised of an equal number of survivors and nongovernmental experts.

text.#text:
Not

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
members shall serve for terms of 2 years
			 and may be reappointed by the

United States Advisory Council on Human Trafficking
Senior Policy Operating Group

text.#text:
be a
			 nongovernmental advisory body to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to
			 review Federal Government policy and programs intended to combat human
			 trafficking, including programs related to the provision of services for
			 victims;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Senior Policy Operating Group

text.#text:
meet, at its own
			 discretion, not less frequently than annually or at the request of the

formulate
			 assessments and recommendations to ensure that United States policy and
			 programming efforts conform, to the extent practicable, to the best practices
			 in the field of human trafficking prevention; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: not less frequently than annually to formally present the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Senior Policy Operating Group
United States Advisory Council on Human Trafficking
